question: What is the wavelength of a stationary wave?
option1: twice the distance between two consecutive nodes or antinodes
option2: equal to the distance between two consecutive nodes or antinodes
option3: half the distance between two consecutive nodes or antinodes
option4: four times the distance between two consecutive nodes or antinodes
answer: twice the distance between two consecutive nodes or antinodes
explanation: Wavelength (Î») of a progressive wave is the distance between two consecutive points of the same phase at a given time. In a stationary wave, it is twice the distance between two consecutive nodes or antinodes.
